instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the DASN model in the related study of the field determination of hazardous chemicals in public security and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the DASN model is the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve. The ROC curve is a graphical representation of the performance of a binary classifier system as its discrimination threshold is varied. It plots the true positive rate (sensitivity) against the false positive rate (1-specificity) at various threshold settings. 

The text mentions that the ROC curve of the DASN model completely encloses the other models, indicating superior performance. Additionally, it states that the area under the curve (AUC) is up to 1, implying excellent robustness. 

The AUC ranges from 0 to 1, where a value of 1 represents a perfect classifier that can perfectly distinguish between positive and negative instances. Therefore, the metric of the ROC curve and its AUC value demonstrate the high accuracy and effectiveness of the DASN model in identifying hazardous chemicals in the field test.

instruction: How does the performance of the deep architecture-search network (DASN) compare to other machine learning and deep learning methods in the field determination of hazardous chemicals using a hand-held Raman spectrometer?
Output: The performance of the deep architecture-search network (DASN) in the field determination of hazardous chemicals using a hand-held Raman spectrometer is superior to other machine learning and deep learning methods. According to the text, DASN achieved an identification accuracy of 100% when tested with the Raman spectra of 300 chemicals, outperforming other methods. The network feature maps of DASN for the spectra of methamphetamine and ketamine focused on the main peaks of 1001 and 652 cm-1, indicating its powerful feature extraction capability. Additionally, the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve of DASN completely enclosed the other models, and the area under the curve was up to 1, demonstrating excellent robustness. Therefore, DASN is more accurate and robust compared to other machine learning and deep learning methods in this context.
